unit: Unit 7 | Inference for Quantitative Data: Means
title: Conditions for Two-sample T Procedures
question_text:
Which of the following statements is/are true regarding the following problem?
Two-sample $T$ procedures can only be used if
I. The samples are two independent SRSs. II. The sampling distribution of the difference is approximately normal. III. The sample sizes are each at least $30$.
solution:
Statement I is true; the samples must be independent and random.

Statement II is true; the sampling distribution of the difference must be approximately normal. This is achieved when either the populations are approximately normal or the combined sample sizes are over $30$.

Statement III is false; while large samples are optimal, they are not a necessary condition.

Thus, the correct answer is Choice 'D'.
